intro: Landolphia mamolava, commonly known as the Madagascar morning glory, is a climbing vine native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that are edible but contain toxic seeds. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and woody. Landolphia mamolava thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
